intro: Pedicularis × wettsteiniana, commonly known as the Wettstein's lousewort, is a hybrid plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes numerous parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its showy, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple, often resembling those of the genus Rhododendron. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it can be challenging to grow outside its native environment.
